statement:
Let $\Omega$ be an open subset of $\mathbb{R}^n \times \mathbb{R}^m$ and
let $f\in C^1(\Omega,\mathbb{R}^m)$. Let
$(x_0,y_0)\in \Omega \subset \mathbb{R}^n\times\mathbb{R}^m$. If the
matrix $D_y f(x_0,y_0)$ defined by
$$D_y f(x_0,y_0) = \left( \frac{\partial f_j}{\partial y_k}(x_0,y_0)\right)_{j,k}
\quad j=1,\ldots,m\quad k=1,\ldots,m$$ is invertible, then there exists
a neighborhood $U\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ of $x_0$ and a function
$g \in C^1(U,\mathbb{R}^m)$ such that
$$f(x,g(x)) = f(x_0,y_0) \qquad \forall x \in U.$$

Moreover $$Dg(x) = - (D_y f(x,g(x))) ^ {-1} D_x f(x,g(x)).$$
